verses.verse: (For the choir director. A Psalm of David.) Hear <WH8085> my voice, <WH6963> O God, <WH430> in my complaint; <WH7879> Preserve <WH5341> my life <WH9132> from dread <WH6343> of the enemy. <WH340>
Hide <WH5641> me from the secret <WH5475> counsel <WH5475> of evildoers, <WH7489> From the tumult <WH9543> of those who do <WH6466> iniquity, <WH205>
Who <WH834> have sharpened <WH8150> their tongue <WH3956> like a sword. <WH2719> They aimed <WH1869> bitter <WH4751> speech <WH1697> [as] their arrow, <WH2671>
To shoot <WH3384> from concealment <WH4565> at the blameless; <WH8535> Suddenly <WH6597> they shoot <WH3384> at him, and do not fear. <WH3372>

They hold <WH2388> fast <WH2388> to themselves an evil <WH7451> purpose; <WH1697> They talk <WH5608> of laying <WH2934> snares <WH4170> secretly; <WH2934> They say, <WH559> "Who <WH4310> can see <WH7200> them?"

They devise <WH2664> injustices, <WH9390> [saying,] "We are ready <WH8552> with a well-conceived plot <WH2665>"; For the inward <WH7130> thought <WH7130> and the heart <WH3820> of a man <WH376> are deep. <WH6013>
But God <WH430> will shoot <WH3384> at them with an arrow; <WH2671> Suddenly <WH6597> they will be wounded. <WH4347>
So they will make him stumble; <WH3782> Their own tongue <WH3956> is against <WH5921> them; All <WH3605> who see <WH7200> them will shake <WH5074> the head.
Then all <WH3605> men <WH120> will fear, <WH3372> And will declare <WH5046> the work <WH6467> of God, <WH430> And will consider <WH7919> what <WH4639> He has done. <WH4639>

The righteous <WH6662> man <WH6662> will be glad <WH8055> in the Lord, <WH3068> and will take <WH2620> refuge <WH2620> in Him; And all <WH3605> the upright <WH3477> in heart <WH3820> will glory. <WH1984>
